description: From Middle English lechecraft (“practise of medicine”), from Old English lǣċecræft (“medicine”), equivalent to leech +‎ -craft. More at leech, craft.

entries.meaning: (historical) The art or practice of healing or medicine.
examples: The course of his adventures at length conducted him to Scotland, where he followed his leechcraft with similar success.

entries.meaning: The skill or expertise of a physician, medical knowledge; medical attendance.
examples: Smitten with apprehension, I crawled unto the cell of one of the brethren, renowned for his leechcraft; [...]
